contextId.information: The words "cut off ... strength" are probably a euphemism for the death of strong, young men; the words "your father's house" are a metonymy for "your family." AT: "I will kill you and all strong, young male descendants in your family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I will cut off your strength and the strength of your father's house

contextId.information: These phrases mean what a person possesses or what they have done to obtain favor from others. This is a polite way of saying he has not stolen, nor has he given or taken bribes. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: from any man's hand ... in my hand

contextId.information: This is a polite way of referring to killing people. AT: "killed the sons of other women, so shall I kill your mother's son" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: made women childless, so shall your mother be childless

contextId.information: Here "fall" means to die. The word "hand" represents the Philistines. This can be stated in active form. AT: "to have the Philistines kill David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines

contextId.information: This is a euphemism for "relieve himself" or "defecate" or "empty his intestines." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
This is a polite way of saying "do not kill me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: do not let my blood fall to the earth
